feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the working days total. Once an unpaid leave request is approved, the system automatically generates a pay deduction reflected on the payroll table. The feature supports both calendar day-based and working day-based leave policies.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month
Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions with multiple calculation base options.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components and calculation methods
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration
Super Admins who have the flexibility to configure unpaid deduction calculation settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection
Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation to access salary proration configuration

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on the payroll table
Company's public holiday calendar must be configured to properly exclude weekends and public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure leave encashment policies
Access to Leave Settings and Leave Policies configuration area with Super Admin privileges
User must have Super admin role to access and modify salary proration settings

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, and approved unpaid leave days; the system also requires knowledge of the applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days) and public holidays falling in the month
Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and choice of salary components to include (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Salary components selection (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method selection (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, and deduction reflected on the payroll table
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation settings that determine daily rate calculations for monthly payroll processing
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on the selected calculation method, affecting first salary and end-of-service settlement amounts

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to factor into calculations.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations. 5. Review which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and save the new proration settings again.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) divided by Number of actual working days in the month; the number of days can be calendar days (e.g., 30 days) if following a calendar days leave policy or working days (e.g., 22 days) if following a working days leave policy; public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days to arrive at the actual working days used in the calculation

Calculation base options are calendar days (all days in a month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (flexible basis set by payroll managers). Most UAE and KSA companies use 30 custom days to comply with labor law requirements.

Salary component options are limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method options are limited to Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Leave encashment configuration affects end-of-service calculations.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated daily and set off against the employee's monthly pay; calculation method and day type must be selected when configuring the policy

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject those transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully identified and subtracted from the total working days when calculating daily pay; for example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with a 22 working day policy, the daily pay calculation must use 20 days instead of 22 days

Calendar days vary by month (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), which affects daily wage calculations. Different calculation methods produce different wage amounts, so selection of the appropriate base is critical.
Super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new leave encashment configuration, allowing them to review potential impacts before finalizing settings

Multiple calculation method options (Basic Only and Basic + Allowances) and day calculation types (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days) are available, requiring careful selection based on organizational leave policy requirements
When payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, Super admin must manually reject and resave transactions to apply new salary proration settings

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and integrates with leave management systems to process approved unpaid leave requests and employee record systems to access salary information

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, public holiday calendar configuration, and leave management systems to determine accurate daily wage rates for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.
The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies
Interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay; similar to leave encashment functionality
Interacts with the Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions; changes impact first salary calculations and end-of-service settlement amounts

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: the calculated daily salary rate used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as total salary divided by actual working days in the month ; Unpaid leave: employee absence from work without compensation, which triggers automatic pay deduction based on the calculated daily pay rate ; Actual working days: the total number of working days in a month minus any public holidays falling within that month ; Calendar days leave policy: a leave policy based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days per month) rather than working days ; Working days leave policy: a leave policy based on working days (e.g., 22 working days per month) excluding weekends and public holidays

Calendar days: the total number of days in a given month. Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays. Custom days: flexible calculation base set by payroll managers according to company policies.

Leave encashment: The process of converting unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: Calculations performed when an employee's employment ends. Daily Wage Calculator: Tool for configuring leave encashment policies. Salary components: Elements of compensation (Basic, Allowances) used in calculations.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing daily wage deductions based on selected calculation basis (Basic Only, Basic + Allowances) and day type (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days); Leave Policies: Configuration settings that define how leave is managed and deducted from pay

Daily Wage Calculator (DWC): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary Proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: custom days, calendar days, or working days—the three methods available for determining prorated salary amounts.

The daily wage calculator is a feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month.
